intro: Hieracium trigonophorum, commonly known as the three-lobed hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are often lobed. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in late summer, producing small seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Hieracium trigonophorum is often found in meadows, pastures, and disturbed soils, and it is considered a common weed in agricultural areas.
